title: 1000 Lines 3: Community Project
vibe: Martian urban centers transition into the stone-hewn halls of a lost Tudor era before dissolving into a humid, vine-choked tropical nightmare.
praise: Philip Brown’s curated OTEX textures and a driving soundtrack by AD_79, Dragonfly, and Psyrus elevate these compact, highly detailed environments.

title: 50 Shades of Graytall
vibe: A monochromatic concrete expanse fractured by pulsating veins of red-and-blue static and endless vertical columns of industrial metal tracking.
praise: The creative constraints led Marcaek and designers like Ribbiks and Xaser to craft surprisingly beautiful environments from Doom’s ugliest assets.

title: 5till L1 Complex
vibe: A massive, desolate industrial labyrinth where cold concrete corridors lead to abandoned cafeterias and silent, monitor-lined libraries.
praise: The meticulous architectural detail and somber atmosphere crafted by Lainos transform a standard base into a hauntingly realistic and immersive exploration.

title: Abandon
vibe: Stark, monochromatic monoliths and massive geometric shapes float within an infinite, silent void, creating a cold and imposing architectural hallucination.
praise: Massive, abstract landscapes crafted by Bemused, Benjogami, and Scotty push the Boom engine to its visual and technical limits.

title: Absolutely Killed
vibe: Dense industrial complexes and lunar outposts sprawl across the Phobos landscape, filled with intricate machinery, flickering computer banks, and expansive outdoor vistas.
praise: The classic Phobos formula is revitalized by scwiba through meticulous detailing and clever secrets that make every map feel fresh yet familiar.

title: Action Doom 2: Urban Brawl
vibe: A gritty, cel-shaded urban jungle where film noir shadows meet vibrant comic book violence across rain-slicked streets and neon-lit subways.
praise: The cel-shaded artistry of Stephen Browning transforms the engine into a gritty comic book world powered by Mike Watson’s complex scripting.

title: Action Doom
vibe: A hyper-stylized 90s arcade world where gritty urban streets collide with secret mushroom kingdoms and pulsating alien motherships.
praise: The cinematic arcade atmosphere fueled by Julian Aubourg’s soundtrack and Stephen Browning’s direction proves that Doom can successfully mimic high-octane 2D shooters.

title: Alpha Accident: Terra Nova
vibe: Clinical medlabs and industrial distilleries sit nestled within a sprawling, high-detail Martian colony undergoing a massive terraforming operation.
praise: The custom-coded turrets and robotic drones integrated by Eugene Guschin breathe fresh mechanical life into the classic techbase aesthetic.

title: Ancient Aliens
vibe: Technicolor Southwestern deserts and neon-soaked space stations collide with Egyptian metaphysics in a vibrant, psychedelic landscape of extraterrestrial conspiracy.
praise: The vibrant visual identity forged by skillsaw’s custom textures and stewboy’s infectious soundtrack creates a cohesive, high-energy atmosphere that redefined modern megawads.

title: Antaresian Reliquary
vibe: A kaleidoscopic odyssey through gleaming lunar outposts, cosmic superclusters, and frozen boreal forests where the architecture feels as sharp and lethal as the atmosphere.
praise: The high-octane weapon modifications and polished map layouts by Seongbae Park transform these disparate community contributions into a cohesive, award-winning showcase.

title: Ar Luminae
vibe: A colossal interstellar voyage bridging the gap between clinical spacecraft corridors and vast, glowing alien vistas where neon-lit geometry floats over rivers of molten rock.
praise: The sheer architectural ambition of Aurelius and Kaito transforms this Supercharge-powered epic into a relentless, high-fidelity gauntlet of modern slaughter design.

title: Arcadia Demade
vibe: Lush botanical gardens and damp, rusted marketplaces are submerged in a chilling blue haze, echoing the claustrophobic decay of a crumbling underwater utopia.
praise: By translating his own BioShock level design into Doom, Jean-Paul LeBreton creates a hauntingly familiar garden atmosphere elevated by John Weekley’s somber score.

title: Arrival
vibe: Crumbling saltstone sanctuaries and moss-choked industrial ruins transition into blood-soaked citadels and organic altars beneath a heavy, verdant sky.
praise: Walker Wright’s meticulously detailed environments find their perfect rhythmic pulse within the atmospheric, synth-driven soundscapes composed by Brayden Hart.

title: Ashes: Afterglow
vibe: A rusted post-apocalyptic sprawl where flooded city districts and radioactive badlands are reclaimed by mutant hordes, junk-armored scavengers, and the hum of a modified motorcycle.
praise: The immersive hub-based exploration and intricate weapon upgrade systems designed by Vostyok and ReformedJoe transform this sequel into a definitive post-apocalyptic odyssey.

title: Austrian Avian Association
vibe: Frost-bitten Alpine peaks and rustic villages of the 1898 Austro-Hungarian Empire serve as a backdrop for a folklore-steeped struggle between humanoid birds and skeletal mountain horrors.
praise: The meticulous total conversion by MundyC transforms the engine into a folk-horror adventure featuring powerful custom weaponry and a unique Alpine-inspired bestiary.

title: Avactor: End of the Fifth Circle
vibe: Lush Caribbean jungles swallow massive Mesoamerican pyramids and intricate stone temples where death-cultists perform rituals amidst ancient, overgrown ruins.
praise: Massive, hour-long maps showcase Eradrop's talent for blending intricate Mesoamerican architecture with a unique bestiary of custom death-cultist enemies.

title: Back to Basics
vibe: Floating fortresses of rusted metal and grey stone drift through a star-flecked void, where sterile tech-base corridors gradually surrender to the corrupted, marble-hewn architecture of a warped moon.
praise: The meticulous vanilla craftsmanship of Esa Repo transforms strict technical limitations into a masterclass of atmospheric, old-school level design.

title: Back to Saturn X: Episode 2
vibe: Rusted industrial complexes and subterranean transit hubs give way to overgrown alien jungles and crumbling stone spires, all unified by a moody, atmospheric palette of deep teals and sun-bleached oranges.
praise: The intricate, vanilla-compatible layouts of esselfortium and skillsaw harmonize with Jimmy’s original score to set a new gold standard for megawads.

title: Back to Saturn X
vibe: Rusted industrial hubs and derelict train stations transition into overgrown jungle ruins and jagged stone towers, all unified by a distinct palette of deep teals, earthy browns, and muted purples.
praise: Meticulous custom textures from esselfortium and Tarnsman create a cohesive industrial aesthetic, perfectly complemented by Jimmy’s original soundtrack and skillsaw’s polished layouts.

title: Base Ganymede: Complete
vibe: Sterile, low-ceilinged lunar outposts give way to oppressive concrete temples and jagged volcanic rifts as the Jovian moon’s crust splits under demonic influence.
praise: The punchy, aggressive level design by Adam Woodmansey revitalizes the classic three-episode structure with a relentless pace and expert resource management.

title: Bastion of Chaos
vibe: Monolithic obsidian spires and jagged crimson architecture loom over vast, shimmering lakes of blood, bathed in the atmospheric glow of advanced dynamic lighting.
praise: The architectural grandeur and atmospheric lighting effects crafted by Bridgeburner56 transform this massive arena into a breathtaking, award-winning spectacle.

title: BGPA Missions: Liberation
vibe: Humid jungles and sun-bleached beaches give way to cold, fortified Incanese complexes and subterranean bunkers on the rugged landscape of Mons Grampius.
praise: The tactical objective-based missions and deep inventory system crafted by Nigel Rowand transform the engine into a sophisticated military simulation.

title: Blade of Agony E1
vibe: Gritty European battlefields and rain-slicked Parisian streets collide with occult excavations, desert outposts, and retro-futuristic lunar bases in a cinematic World War II reimagining.
praise: The cinematic scope and narrative depth achieved by Daniel Gimmer and his team transform the engine into a high-fidelity historical epic.

title: Breach
vibe: A sprawling, hyper-detailed industrial complex where cold metal silos and flickering blue terminals overlook toxic reservoirs and crumbling concrete walkways.
praise: The meticulous sector detailing and atmospheric lighting by Aline Bee transform a standard tech-base into a hauntingly believable industrial nightmare.

title: Brigandine
vibe: A monolithic, vine-encrusted cathedral of weathered stone and blood-slicked marble, where towering bookshelves and hidden grottoes overlook a landscape of decaying gothic grandeur.
praise: The meticulous detailing and atmospheric depth provided by Aline Bee transform a single map into an expansive, award-winning adventure.

title: Brutal Doom
vibe: A hyper-violent landscape where every corridor is repainted in thick, dripping arterial spray and shattered bone fragments amidst 'brutalized' architectural enhancements.
praise: The visceral combat and elaborate gore systems developed by Marcos Abenante (Sergeant Mark IV) transformed the aging engine into a modern, high-octane bloodbath.

title: Cheogsh
vibe: A gothic odyssey through ruined temples and an eerie subterranean city where taverns and catacombs sit beneath a shifting, blood-red sky.
praise: Atmospheric GZDoom scripting and unique monsters define Shadowman’s haunting narrative journey dedicated to the memory of a lost friend.

title: Chex Quest 3
vibe: A vibrant, cereal-themed universe where colorful urban centers and industrial laboratories are overrun by gelatinous, green-skinned invaders from the dimension of Bazoik.
praise: This polished, family-friendly expansion by Charles Jacobi perfectly captures the whimsical charm of the original cereal-box classic while adding significant new depth.

title: Chosen
vibe: Sandstone temples and sphinx-guarded passages descend into a mythological Egyptian underworld where the sun-scorched surface gives way to the shadowy depths of the Duat.
praise: The meticulous Egyptian total conversion by Lil' White Mouse transforms the engine into a mythological odyssey featuring unique weapons and atmospheric storytelling.

title: Cold as Hell
vibe: A frigid 1950s military outpost in Greenland where rusted research stations and isolation complexes are buried under a relentless, blinding blizzard.
praise: The immersive survival horror atmosphere crafted by Jonaya Riley and Ben Wachal transforms Doom into a tense, objective-driven military thriller.

title: Comatose
vibe: A sprawling, hyper-detailed expanse of rusted industrial railroads and decaying residential blocks frozen in a silent, sun-bleached state of urban decay.
praise: The staggering architectural density and somber environmental storytelling achieved by Lainos elevate this single-map release into a hauntingly memorable masterpiece.

title: Combat Shock 2
vibe: Industrial complexes of cold steel and flickering machinery bleed into jagged obsidian fortresses, creating a high-voltage atmosphere of mechanical dread.
praise: The relentless pacing and meticulous monster placement from Daniel Jakobsson deliver a high-octane experience that remains a gold standard for slaughter-style design.

title: Community Chest 2
vibe: A sprawling, inconsistent tapestry of industrial decay, where rusted coolant platforms and marble cathedrals are swallowed by vast, slime-choked sewers and impossible geometric voids.
praise: The atmospheric dread of Bernard De Windt’s industrial ruins and Erik Alm’s tight layouts cement this collection as a landmark of collaborative design.

title: Community Chest 3
vibe: A sprawling odyssey through subterranean mines, sunken cities, and gargantuan industrial complexes that stretch toward an infinite, oppressive horizon.
praise: Andy Leaver’s revival showcases grand architectural scale through Matt Tropiano’s massive layouts and Thomas van der Velden’s distinctively creative environmental detailing.

title: Community Chest 4
vibe: A sprawling, high-fidelity odyssey through decaying industrial installations, subterranean grottos, and suburban nightmares unified by a versatile, era-defining palette of detailed textures.
praise: The influential texture resource anchors diverse contributions from mappers like skillsaw and Phobus, while Jimmy and Mechadon deliver standout collaborative architecture.

title: Congestion 1024
vibe: A series of hyper-dense architectural dioramas where sprawling industrial complexes and gothic cathedrals are crushed into suffocatingly small, self-contained cubes of reality.
praise: The spatial ingenuity of The Flange Peddler and fellow mappers thrives alongside Rachel Schmitz’s original score, proving massive ambition fits inside tiny boundaries.

title: Counterattack
vibe: Vast, hyper-detailed industrial complexes and monolithic stone citadels rise from desolate plains, blending intricate mechanical conduits with oppressive, ancient geometry.
praise: The meticulous sector-detailing and grand architectural scale Brett Harrell achieves makes every environment feel like a massive, lived-in industrial monument.

title: Crimson Canyon
vibe: Industrial outposts and high-tech shrines are carved directly into the jagged, rust-colored cliffs of a sprawling desert canyon system.
praise: The cohesive red-rock aesthetic crafted by Jeffrey Graham shines alongside Rachel Schmitz’s atmospheric score, earning this episode its well-deserved Cacoward.

title: Crucified Dreams
vibe: Weathered stone arches and verdigris-stained cathedrals stand frozen under a perpetual snowfall, where tattered ruins and jagged geometry bleed into a somber, gothic limbo.
praise: Derek MacDonald’s hands-on refinement of Scott Cover’s vision transforms these gothic arenas into a sharp showcase of Lee Szymanski’s tiered layouts.

title: Curse of D'Sparil
vibe: Desolate medieval cities and frozen citadels drift through a haunting dreamscape where the boundaries of reality blur into a cold, ethereal nightmare.
praise: The atmospheric level design by Kristian Käll, featuring a standout secret map by his brother Karl, revitalizes the Heretic engine with professional-grade architecture.

title: Dark Universe
vibe: A derelict UAC starship where intricate 3D geometry and atmospheric lighting reveal sprawling mechanical vistas and claustrophobic corridors swallowed by an otherworldly void.
praise: The cinematic storytelling and detailed environmental design of Paul Dechene elevate this spaceship crawl through clever use of GZDoom’s 3D capabilities.

title: DBK03: Shrine of the Silver CyberPrimate
vibe: A humid Mesoamerican jungle where crumbling stone pyramids and vine-choked ruins are retrofitted with high-tech machinery and the kitschy aesthetic of a 90s televised adventure game show.
praise: The Mesoamerican adventure crafted by Big Ol' Billy and the Digital Bards Krew excels through inventive ZDoom-powered traps and a nostalgic, genre-bending soundtrack.

title: dead.air
vibe: A fractured digital metropolis where corporate news architecture dissolves into a surreal broadcast nightmare of neon static and corrupted signal interference.
praise: The inventive custom arsenal and glitchy aesthetic crafted by Xaser Acheron transform a routine debugging mission into a visually stunning sensory overload.

title: dead.wire
vibe: A glitching, digital purgatory where familiar UAC corridors dissolve into a silent void populated by translucent phantoms and shifting geometric anomalies.
praise: The surreal atmosphere and inventive weapon replacements crafted by Xaser Acheron transform a classic layout into a haunting, high-tech fever dream.

title: Decade
vibe: Industrial corridors and toxic refineries merge with gothic keeps in a hyper-detailed architectural mosaic that reinterprets the most iconic landmarks of the early Martian invasion.
praise: The meticulous architectural detailing and scripted sequences by Russell Pearson transform nostalgic layouts into a sophisticated, atmospheric tribute to the series' first decade.

title: Demons of Problematique 2
vibe: Rain-slicked industrial corridors and flooded stone dungeons are swallowed by an oppressive, pitch-black gloom punctuated only by the eerie flicker of colored dynamic lights.
praise: The atmospheric lighting and intricate GZDoom architecture crafted by Dennis Meuwissen transform every encounter into a tense, cinematic puzzle.

title: Deus Vult II
vibe: Vast, monolithic fortresses of black stone, sun-scorched desert temples, and shimmering cosmic gateways form a grand-scale architectural odyssey spanning from gothic cathedrals to the stars.
praise: The staggering architectural scale and custom monster additions showcase Huy Pham’s talent for crafting a cinematic experience that redefined Boom-compatible visual standards.

title: Dimension of the Boomed
vibe: A low-fidelity nightmare of rusted industrial slipgates and gothic stone fortresses submerged in murky brown bogs and eldritch shadows.
praise: The seamless integration of Quake’s oppressive atmosphere into the Doom engine showcases Stephen Wadsworth’s talent for creating a hauntingly nostalgic crossover.

title: Don't Turn Your Back on the City
vibe: A dense metropolitan labyrinth where grime-streaked alleys and cluttered storefronts sit beneath the oppressive shadow of towering brick architecture.
praise: The staggering architectural density achieved by Suzanne Will transforms a single city block into a landmark display of sector-based realism.

title: Doom 2 In City Only
vibe: A sprawling urban odyssey shifting from contemporary skylines and neon-lit futures to ancient desert metropolises and crumbling hellish suburbs.
praise: The diverse urban landscapes curated by Alex Decker showcase a creative range of architecture from Muumi’s transcendence to cannonball’s brutalist hell.

title: Doom 2 in Spain Only
vibe: A garbled, mistranslated landscape where the familiar architecture of Earth and Hell is filtered through the lens of a budget Spanish bootleg, complete with fractured signage and surreal, Google-translated geography.
praise: The uncanny mimicry of id Software’s design by Richard Frei and his collaborators creates a hilarious, high-effort parody of bootleg gaming culture.

title: Doom 2 the Way id Did
vibe: Industrial shipyards and flooded libraries give way to jagged, nonsensical hellscapes and hidden, cartoonish dimensions of Vorticon technology.
praise: Replicating the distinct architectural quirks of the original id team, Tarnsman, esselfortium, and Alfonzo craft a pitch-perfect alternate-history sequel to Doom II.

title: Doom: The Golden Souls 2
vibe: A kaleidoscopic journey through floating grassy plains, sun-drenched tropical ports, and candy-coated skies, all connected by a sprawling overworld map and hidden secret paths.
praise: The ambitious platforming mechanics and upgradable arsenal designed by Batandy transform the traditional shooter into a sprawling, coin-collecting adventure.

title: Doom the Way id Did
vibe: Industrial Phobos outposts transition into warped Deimos installations and abstract, jagged marble hellscapes that mirror the specific architectural quirks of 1993.
praise: Meticulous design work by Hellbent, ellmo, and esselfortium captures the idiosyncratic mapping quirks of the original id Software team with uncanny precision.

title: Double Impact
vibe: Cavernous industrial hangars and cramped ventilation ducts form a massive, grime-streaked labyrinth of flickering terminals and exposed machinery.
praise: The sprawling, non-linear environments crafted by Matt Cibulas and Ralph Vickers transform the familiar Phobos base into a dense and intimidating tactical challenge.

title: Dreamblood
vibe: A surreal odyssey through shifting dreamscapes where lunar electricity, Martian embers, and polluted industrial ruins collide under the eerie, high-contrast glow of the Doom 64 engine.
praise: The technical wizardry of HeadshotTAS transforms the engine through complex scripting, while haunting melodies from Proxy-MIDI and Immorpher deepen the surreal atmosphere.

title: Drip Feed
vibe: A colossal, monolithic citadel of weathered stone and iron rises from a desolate, rocky expanse, its grand courtyards and imposing battlements radiating an aura of ancient, fortified dread.
praise: The grand scale and intricate secret-hunting of Trevor Primmett’s citadel earned its Cacoward by blending epic architecture with rewarding exploration.

title: Dust Devil
vibe: An arid, storm-lashed mining world where sleek UAC research facilities collide with the crumbling, sun-bleached stone of an ancient desert civilization.
praise: The inventive bestiary and seamless environmental storytelling from Captain Toenail transform a dusty archaeological dig into a polished, award-winning adventure.

title: Elementalism: Phase 1
vibe: Primordial realms of overgrown jungle ruins, submerged crystalline temples, and molten industrial forges house the fading power of ancient elemental gods.
praise: The ambitious adventure-style mapping of Ben Mansell (Bauul) and Joshua O'Sullivan (Dragonfly) transforms GZDoom’s technical capabilities into a grand elemental odyssey.

title: Elf Gets Pissed
vibe: Damp stone catacombs and sun-scorched canyons collide with surreal occult oddities, where medieval architecture is haunted by massive canine totems and explosive poultry.
praise: The punchy level design and creative custom weaponry by Matt Cibulas breathe fresh, chaotic life into the aging Heretic engine.

title: Epic 2
vibe: Sand-swept Egyptian necropolises and sandstone temples give way to the sterile, high-tech corridors of orbiting alien vessels and shimmering astral landscapes.
praise: The grand architectural scale and intricate puzzles crafted by Alexander S. elevate this journey through beautifully textured ancient and alien worlds.

title: Epic
vibe: Dust-choked sandstone temples and grand citadels rise from sun-scorched Egyptian dunes, where ancient hieroglyphs watch over shifting desert sands and forgotten tombs.
praise: The grand Egyptian architecture and atmospheric world-building by Alexander S. (Eternal) create a sense of scale rarely seen in 2007.

title: Erkattäññe
vibe: Fluid, organic starport corridors and irregular chambers create a minimalist industrial labyrinth defined by sweeping curves and a restrained, cohesive palette.
praise: The nostalgic 1990s aesthetic is elevated by Nicolás Monti’s mastery of irregular shapes and a surprisingly catchy pop-infused MIDI soundtrack.

title: Escape from Castle Chezcrea
vibe: A sprawling stone fortress where industrial conveyor belts and dark, damp caverns hide interactive tools like pickaxes behind crumbling masonry.
praise: Paul Hiebert’s inventive use of interactive environment puzzles and custom mechanics transforms a standard castle escape into a highly memorable adventure.

title: Eternal Doom IV: Return from Oblivion
vibe: Massive medieval fortresses and sprawling stone crypts stand frozen in time, blending ancient gothic masonry with strange, otherworldly technology.
praise: The grand architectural scale and atmospheric detailing from Rex Claussen, Chris Couleur, and Espi perfectly capture the legendary TeamTNT sense of adventure.

title: Eviternity II
vibe: Decaying autumnal ruins and frozen hyperborean wastes give way to a celestial void where feathered wings and cosmic divinity preside over impossible architecture.
praise: The ambitious scope of Joshua O'Sullivan's team shines through Tristan Clark's bespoke soundtrack and the devastating Perforator weapon envisioned by ukiro.

title: Eviternity
vibe: A journey through shifting realities, transitioning from mossy medieval ruins and frozen wastes into a pristine, celestial afterlife of white marble and gold.
praise: Joshua O'Sullivan's meticulous design and ukiro’s bespoke OTEX textures create a polished, multi-themed epic that feels like a professional expansion.

title: Faithless: Trilogy
vibe: Interconnected portals stitch together a decaying fantasy landscape of emerald gardens, iron-clad fortresses, and blood-soaked cloisters where the realms of Parthoris and Cronos collide.
praise: The expansive hub-based architecture and bespoke arsenal crafted by James Paddock elevate this Heretic odyssey into a definitive modern dark fantasy experience.

title: Finely Crafted Fetish Film
vibe: Monolithic, abstract structures float within a silent, hazy purgatory where blooming roses and intricate clockwork mechanisms punctuate the lonely, grey architecture.
praise: The intricate puzzle-box architecture of Zachary Stephens transforms the traditional shooter into a cerebral, high-stakes gauntlet of environmental navigation.

title: Foreverhood
vibe: A melancholic, dreamlike landscape of misty mountains and dense woods where small, childlike beings wander under the watchful eyes of towering, enigmatic guardians.
praise: Surreal world-building and experimental storytelling by Brian Goodsell earned this total conversion a Cacoward for its unique, non-traditional vision.

title: Forsaken Overlook
vibe: A sprawling stone fortress perched atop jagged cliffs and isolated islands, overlooking a desolate landscape of weathered rock and ancient masonry.
praise: Matt Tropiano’s intricate, vertical architecture captures a sense of grand scale, perfectly complemented by the somber melodies of James Paddock.

title: Fractured Worlds
vibe: Jagged obsidian architecture drifts through a star-flecked void, bathed in a monochromatic teal glow that blurs the line between cosmic and digital.
praise: Nirvana crafts a hauntingly beautiful teal odyssey, sharpened by Ribbiks’ technical guidance and punishing guest maps from Scotty and Insane_Gazebo.

title: Fuel Devourer
vibe: A sprawling industrial complex of glowing lava pits and metallic rods, where red-lit control rooms overlook vast, toxic-choked cisterns and intricate ventilation networks.
praise: The intricate industrial architecture and custom axe-wielding zombies crafted by C4tnt and Arthur O. earned this dense adventure a well-deserved Cacoward.

title: Genesis of Descent
vibe: Shadow-drenched industrial shafts and subterranean vaults are illuminated by the flickering hum of ancient machinery and eerie, ambient colored lighting.
praise: Immersive cinematic scripting and moody lighting allow Nick Laurent to transform a standard tech-base into a haunting, award-winning descent.

title: Ghouls vs Humans
vibe: A suffocating, pitch-black woodland where gnarled trees and oppressive shadows conceal pale, distorted entities lurking within the absolute silence.
praise: By blending primal fear with sudden lethality, Cutmanmike transformed the engine into a psychological horror playground that remains legendary for its scares.

title: Godless Night
vibe: A gothic gallery of haunted portraits serves as a gateway to crumbling chapels, mechanical gardens, and cosmic voids steeped in the atmosphere of a cursed, eternal night.
praise: Tango’s seamless integration of Supercharge into a Castlevania-inspired world is bolstered by guest maps from Aurelius, RonnieJamesDiner, and reflex17.

title: Going Down
vibe: A vertical plunge through a corporate monolith where sterile boardrooms and grimy maintenance tunnels give way to a surreal, gore-slicked descent into the building's literal and metaphorical bowels.
praise: The frantic, 'chaotic-evil' level design and quirky original soundtrack by Cyriak Harris transform a simple office building into a uniquely hilarious and punishing gauntlet.

title: Gravity
vibe: Majestic stone citadels and surreal castles rise with impossible verticality, blending classical masonry with dreamlike, gravity-defying structures.
praise: The soaring verticality and intricate masonry crafted by Alexander S. (Eternal) create a sense of architectural grandeur rarely seen in limit-removing maps.

title: Grove
vibe: A nocturnal, suffocating forest where crumbling ruins and eerie stone circles are swallowed by a pervasive darkness that hides giant stone hands and shimmering gemstone skulls.
praise: The haunting original compositions and atmospheric environmental storytelling by Bernard De Windt transform a simple forest into a tense, award-winning survival horror masterpiece.

title: Hardfest 2
vibe: A kaleidoscopic fever dream where neon-drenched ritual sites and frozen voids collide with unsettling dollhouses and digital mainframes under a shifting, psychedelic sky.
praise: The experimental monster variants and high-octane pacing within this finnks13-led project thrive on the eclectic, atmospheric soundscapes provided by LPad.

title: Harmony
vibe: A vibrant post-apocalyptic wasteland populated by clay-molded mutants and neon-hued ruins, depicting a world where a viral plague has transformed the male population into a monstrous new order.
praise: The handcrafted claymation enemies and vibrant color palette designed by Thomas van der Velden transform this total conversion into a distinct, tactile sci-fi odyssey.

title: Haste
vibe: A surreal odyssey through monolithic stone temples, verdant overgrowths, and sepia-toned voids where ancient architecture floats amidst a diverse, dreamlike soundscape.
praise: Scotty’s punchy challenges expand into Insane_Gazebo’s grand-scale architecture, enriched by Ribbiks’ intricate combat puzzles and Nirvana’s atmospheric detail.

title: Heartland
vibe: Gritty industrial sprawl and urban decay collide within a world of complex machinery, subterranean transit systems, and towering brick-and-steel monoliths.
praise: Paul DeBruyne and Xaser deliver a transformative arsenal that pairs perfectly with the smooth, jazzy compositions of Stuart Rynn.

title: HeDRoX
vibe: A dense, hyper-detailed techbase defined by jagged, intricate geometry and complex machinery that pushes the limits of sector-based construction.
praise: The intricate, award-winning architecture crafted by Rodrigo Acevedo transforms a standard techbase into a dense showcase of mid-2000s ZDoom detailing.

title: Hell-Forged
vibe: A crumbling medieval kingdom fueled by forbidden sorcery sinks into a volcanic abyss of obsidian fortresses and blood-slicked catacombs.
praise: The intricate custom assets and elemental combat systems designed by Amuscaria transform a standard invasion into a hauntingly detailed dark fantasy epic.

title: Hell Ground
vibe: Twisted Gothic architecture and surreal dreamscapes drift through a somber, melancholic gloom, haunted by the unsettling echoes of a Victorian nightmare.
praise: The haunting atmosphere and surreal visual storytelling crafted by Alexander S. elevate these seven maps into a uniquely unsettling masterpiece of Doom modding.

title: Hell Revealed II
vibe: A relentless descent through industrial metal complexes and monolithic granite cathedrals that eventually dissolve into vast, scorched hellscapes of brimstone and ancient pyramids.
praise: The punishing level design led by Jonas Feragen and Andy Olivera finds its pulse in Sam Woodman’s driving, high-energy industrial soundtrack.

title: Hellcore 2.0
vibe: Rain-slicked urban decay and gothic architecture collide in a cinematic descent through haunted city streets and surreal, Lovecraftian dreamscapes.
praise: The meticulous atmospheric detailing and cinematic pacing provided by Robert Babor and Devon West elevate this journey into a haunting, award-winning horror experience.

title: Hi-Tech Hell 2 - Alien Tech
vibe: Sleek, multi-layered research facilities and teleportation laboratories where cold industrial steel meets glowing extraterrestrial machinery beneath the shadow of a waiting transport plane.
praise: The cinematic storytelling and advanced 3D architecture crafted by Simo Malinen earned this tech-base adventure a well-deserved Cacoward.

title: Hocus Pocus Doom
vibe: A vibrant, storybook realm of oversized mushrooms, crystalline ice palaces, and ancient wizard towers rendered in the saturated palette of a 90s shareware fantasy.
praise: The meticulous translation of 2D platforming logic into a 3D space by Fletcher` creates a nostalgic, high-energy tribute to Apogee's golden era.

title: House of Dead Skin
vibe: A sprawling, beige-toned labyrinth where ancient pyramid structures and industrial piping are slowly being consumed by pulsating, organic hellgrowth.
praise: The massive scale and intricate sector work of ivymagnapinna's design creates a haunting atmosphere, perfectly complemented by Ribbiks' melancholic musical score.

title: IC2005
vibe: A sprawling industrial labyrinth of interlocking crate warehouses and high-tech computer cores, submerged in the gritty, mechanical gloom of a deep-space refinery.
praise: The intricate architecture and massive scale established by Ian Cunnings earned this map a Cacoward for its ahead-of-its-time technical ambition.

title: Icebound
vibe: A frozen fortress of jagged stone and ancient masonry where icy waterfalls spill into hidden grottoes and lava-filled caverns beneath a docked wooden vessel.
praise: The intricate sector detail and atmospheric lighting crafted by Christopher Lutz transform this frozen citadel into a sprawling, award-winning adventure.

title: Infested
vibe: Pulsating, fleshy growths and organic nests anchor themselves to the clean lines of a small-town art gallery, corrupting the local architecture with hellish rot.
praise: The inventive Gore Nest mechanics and tactical weapon overhauls by ginc transform routine demon extermination into a polished, award-winning arcade experience.

title: Infraworld - Coma Moonlight
vibe: A sprawling, moonlit fortress of intricate stone and glowing purple energy bridges suspended over a dark, ethereal abyss.
praise: The meticulous architectural detail and atmospheric lighting crafted by StormCatcher.77 elevate this surreal fortress into a haunting, award-winning adventure.

title: Insanity Edged
vibe: A frigid, industrial landscape where rusted machinery and glitching reality bleed into a melancholic, snow-dusted void of forgotten memories.
praise: The cinematic storytelling and polished GZDoom effects Pieruskwurje employs create a hauntingly atmospheric journey that elevates the standard shooter experience.

title: Japanese Community Project
vibe: A kaleidoscopic odyssey through rural valleys, magnetic research facilities, and emerald-hued hellscapes, blending traditional industrial grit with surreal, neon-tinged dreamscapes.
praise: The eclectic mapping styles of burabojunior and Nanka Kurashiki coalesce under Tatsurd-Cacocaco’s leadership to form a vibrant, award-winning cultural showcase.

title: Jenesis
vibe: Rusted industrial refineries and radioactive oceans give way to putrid cathedrals and volcanic abysses, blending classic nineties aesthetics with sharp, modern detailing.
praise: James Paddock’s speedmapped layouts harmonize with a diverse, award-winning soundtrack from Stuart Rynn and other legendary composers for a cohesive solo experience.

title: Jumpwad
vibe: Snowy temples and surreal ice cream factories float amidst a void of falling flakes, punctuated by glowing gems and pulsating fire crystals.
praise: The ingenious DeHackEd wizardry of Zachary Stephens and Grain of Salt transforms a classic shooter into a precision platforming masterpiece.

title: Kama Sutra
vibe: Industrial complexes and medieval fortresses give way to surreal, anatomical landscapes where the architecture itself becomes a provocative, flesh-toned hallucination.
praise: The speedrunning pedigree of Adolf Vojta and Jakub Razak infuses these maps with an aggressive flow and a playfully irreverent spirit.

title: Khorus' Speedy Shit
vibe: A series of compact, abstract fortresses and industrial outposts where the architecture feels jagged, spontaneous, and stripped down to its most primal, utilitarian forms.
praise: The raw, high-energy layouts crafted by Adam Woodmansey gain extra depth through the polished, guest-designed secret levels by Brian Knox and Tango.

title: Knee-Deep in Knee-Deep in ZDoom
vibe: A Phobos soundstage where flickering camera monitors and impossible architectural illusions transform industrial moon-base corridors into a high-budget television reenactment.
praise: The technical ingenuity of esselfortium and the KDiKDiZD team pushes vanilla limits to deliver a detailed, feature-rich demake of a modern classic.

title: Knee-Deep in ZDoom
vibe: Industrial Phobos installations expand into vast, sloped complexes of humming machinery and flickering shadows that bridge the gap between classic Martian outposts and gritty Quake II tech-bases.
praise: Cinematic technical wizardry from Graf Zahl and Daniel Gimmer reimagines Phobos through sprawling architecture and Vader’s diverse, meticulously animated monster roster.

title: Kuchitsu
vibe: Clean, vanilla-textured vignettes transition from serene islands and leaky industrial corridors to a miniature urban sprawl beneath a quiet sky.
praise: The understated elegance of Memfis’s level design shines through these compact maps, earning a well-deserved Cacoward for their refined simplicity.

title: Legacy of Heroes
vibe: Crumbling Mediterranean ruins and perched mountain monasteries give way to vast, silent libraries and subterranean villages steeped in ancient mythological grandeur.
praise: The grand adventure-style architecture crafted by gaspe evokes the spirit of Eternal Doom while delivering a polished, modern sense of scale.

title: Legacy of Suffering
vibe: A sterile, shadow-drenched lunar research facility where flickering emergency lights and industrial monorails give way to a surreal, metal-scored descent into the abyss.
praise: The cinematic atmosphere and brutal custom weaponry crafted by Logan MTM transform the engine into a gritty, Doom 3-inspired horror experience.

title: lilith
vibe: A digital purgatory where the fabric of reality unravels into a jagged mosaic of corrupted textures, flickering sprites, and broken geometry.
praise: The way anotak weaponizes technical bugs and engine instability creates a haunting, avant-garde experience that redefines the limits of the software renderer.

title: Liminal Doom 2: Crossing the Threshold
vibe: Mundane, everyday environments like empty offices and quiet hallways dissolve into a surreal, dreamlike expanse where the familiar world feels unsettlingly hollow and alien.
praise: The haunting atmosphere and clever use of custom soundscapes by dashlet create a uniquely unsettling experience that redefines the liminal space aesthetic.

title: Lost Civilization
vibe: Vast, hyper-detailed landscapes transition from misty mountain passes and sun-drenched farmlands to decaying suburban sprawl and crumbling metropolitan ruins.
praise: The sprawling, non-linear environments crafted by Jaakko Impola feel remarkably lived-in, especially when paired with the atmospheric, melodic soundscapes of Bjørn Lynne.

title: Lullaby
vibe: A surreal, violet-hued dreamscape where floating star-shaped islands and impossible libraries drift through a cosmic, starlit abyss.
praise: The ethereal atmosphere crafted by Daniel Alexander utilizes GZDoom’s advanced features to create a hauntingly beautiful, award-winning journey through a nightmare.

title: Lunatic
vibe: Sleek, silver-plated research labs and humming supercomputers overlook the silent, cratered desolation of a lunar landscape under a star-choked sky.
praise: The vibrant lunar aesthetics and lethal custom monster variants crafted by Paul DeBruyne deliver a polished, high-energy experience that feels distinctively modern.

title: Malevolence
vibe: A sprawling lunar terraforming colony where sterile, interconnected tech-bases are being repurposed into cold, industrial cyborg factories by a rogue super-intelligence.
praise: The meticulous environmental storytelling and custom cyborg roster crafted by Cheesewheel transform these vanilla-styled tech-bases into a cohesive, atmospheric sci-fi horror experience.

title: Mandrill Ass Project
vibe: A kaleidoscopic journey through digital circuitry, confectionery factories, and neon-drenched virtual realities where tropical surf breaks meet high-altitude aerial dogfights.
praise: The bizarre, genre-bending environments crafted by Aluqah utilize GZDoom's features to transform a series of whimsical fever dreams into a Cacoward-winning reality.

title: Mapgame
vibe: A sterile lunar outpost where flickering circuits and chemical decay bleed into a cold, dystopian industrial landscape bathed in an eerie, shifted color palette.
praise: The custom palette and inventive flare gun mechanics introduced by Fletcher` elevate this techbase odyssey into a celebrated, award-winning experience.

title: Maskim Xul
vibe: Ancient Sumerian ruins and eldritch voids bleed into a Lovecraftian nightmare of ritualistic altars, cosmic decay, and mouths embedded in the very walls.
praise: James Caldwell’s ambitious DeHackEd modifications reinvent the arsenal and bestiary, turning every encounter into a tense, Lovecraftian puzzle of survival.

title: Mayan Mishap
vibe: Lush jungle ruins and ancient stone temples are drenched in a hallucinatory palette of deep purples and vibrant greens, punctuated by the glow of mystical white and light-blue keys.
praise: The polished speedmaps of Tango shine through a custom palette and inventive DeHackEd monsters like the flying, tentacled greater mancubus.

title: Miasma
vibe: A sprawling, emerald-hued industrial cathedral choking on toxic sludge and overgrown moss, where jagged rock formations pierce through a thick, suffocating atmosphere of decay.
praise: The intricate architecture and oppressive atmosphere crafted by Thomas Seifert transform a single map into a sprawling, award-winning epic of toxic beauty.

title: Monster Hunter Ltd. Part I
vibe: A grimy industrial sprawl where rusted silos and waste-clogged tunnels intersect amidst a dense labyrinth of heavy machinery and scrap.
praise: The intricate sector-based detailing by Didy creates a tactile sense of place that earned this industrial hunt its Cacoward.

title: Mutabor
vibe: A monochromatic emerald fever dream where toxic greens bleed into every texture, illuminating a surreal landscape of mutated guardians and glowing, verdant artifacts.
praise: The meticulous visual cohesion and refined combat puzzles crafted by Thomas Seifert earned this emerald-hued masterpiece a well-deserved Cacoward.

title: Mutiny
vibe: A rain-slicked dystopian sprawl of crumbling slums, high-tech corporate fortresses, and industrial shipyards choked by urban decay.
praise: Gritty urban decay and industrial sprawl come alive through Jon Vail's direction and a diverse soundtrack composed primarily by Jimmy.

title: My House
vibe: A mundane suburban residence that unravels into a shifting, non-Euclidean nightmare of liminal airports, flooded bathhouses, and infinite concrete labyrinths.
praise: The technical wizardry of Steve Nelson transforms a simple domestic map into a haunting, multi-layered exploration of grief and impossible architecture.

title: Necromantic Thirst
vibe: Emerald-tinted mists and jagged stone ruins bleed into toxic industrial complexes, creating a dark, necromantic landscape of gothic decay and high-contrast geometry.
praise: The French Doom Community's technical mastery shines through franckFRAG’s leadership, pairing WH-Wilou84’s intricate architecture with a hauntingly eclectic soundtrack.

title: NewDoom Community Project II
vibe: Gritty industrial complexes and organic alien hives collide with surreal, crystalline dimensions under a heavy atmosphere of cinematic synth and industrial metal.
praise: Ambitious architecture and creative monster replacements from contributors like Ronald Lubbelinkhof and Josh Sealy deliver a memorable, award-winning community odyssey.

title: Newdoom Community Project
vibe: A sprawling mosaic of industrial processing plants, decaying urban ruins, and jagged obsidian fortresses that shift from sterile tech-bases to surreal, blood-soaked gothic cathedrals.
praise: The architectural precision of Esa Repo and Dennis Meuwissen anchors this diverse collection, showcasing the creative peak of a legendary forum community.

title: Nihility: Infinite Teeth
vibe: A cold, industrial purgatory of flickering tech-bases and blood-slicked factories, echoing with the hollow hum of machinery and the ghosts of Doom's early development.
praise: The alpha-inspired aesthetics and clever DeHackEd monster variants crafted by Years create a hauntingly unique atmosphere that prioritizes dread over traditional music.

title: No End In Sight
vibe: Grime-streaked industrial corridors and decaying lunar outposts gradually dissolve into a jagged, organic nightmare of blood-soaked earth and twisted, non-Euclidean architecture.
praise: Meticulous, grime-focused architecture from Emil Brundage, Xaser, and Christopher Lutz transforms the familiar id Software aesthetic into a claustrophobic, weathered masterpiece.

title: No Rest for the Living
vibe: Industrial military outposts give way to scorched canyons and ancient, blood-soaked catacombs as the barrier between Earth and Hell begins to fracture once more.
praise: The dense, high-pressure level design from Nerve Software’s Arya Iwakura and Russell Meakim revitalizes the classic Doom II aesthetic with modern encounter complexity.

title: Nostalgic Entropy: Neo Retro
vibe: A vaporwave shopping mall where neon-drenched corridors give way to warped corporate offices and crystalline pools under a hazy, electronic sky.
praise: The meticulous architectural detail and vibrant color palette established by AshtralFiend transform a surreal shopping center into a hauntingly beautiful arena.

title: Operation Overlord
vibe: A gritty, salt-sprayed amphibious assault on a fortified coastline where Incan-inspired military bunkers and mine-choked sands guard a lush South American stronghold.
praise: The tactical cover mechanics and detailed military atmosphere crafted by Nigel Rowand transform a standard beach landing into a cinematic total conversion.

title: Osterity
vibe: A surreal, Texas-tinged frontier where industrial outposts and distorted chapels are overrun by undead cowboys and scientific horrors under a hazy, palette-swapped sky.
praise: The inventive DeHackEd monsters and original soundtrack by Big Ol' Billy transform ukiro’s OTEX textures into a quirky, award-winning adventure.

title: OTEX Texture Pack
vibe: Moss-covered Cambodian ruins, sleek Art Deco corridors, and weathered industrial bunkers converge under high-resolution skies to form a sprawling, multi-era architectural tapestry.
praise: The expansive texture library by Ola Björling provides mappers with a professional-grade palette that elevated the entire community's visual standards.

title: Overboard
vibe: A sun-drenched tropical getaway where luxury cruise liners and white-sand beaches collide with volcanic peaks and palm-fringed archipelagos.
praise: The frantic island-hopping mayhem is elevated by Cyriak Harris’s signature quirky soundtrack and a clever New Game Plus mode that reimagines every map.

title: Ozonia
vibe: Lush lunar outposts and ancient Inca ruins collide with industrial dams and citadels suspended over a surreal, abyssal void.
praise: The atmospheric, custom-composed soundtrack by Tomás Soares elevates these strategic setpiece encounters and unique monster additions to award-winning heights.

title: Paradise
vibe: Lush, verdant jungles and tropical safaris slowly decay into toxic, acid-soaked marshes and scorched hellscapes.
praise: The punchy weapon overhauls and deterministic damage systems crafted by Tango transform these tropical vistas into a remarkably consistent and satisfying experience.

title: Phobia: The Age
vibe: Desolate badlands and fractured, blood-soaked corridors drift within a surreal void, manifesting a haunting landscape born from deep-seated psychological terrors.
praise: The atmospheric architecture of Kristian Käll blends seamlessly with Marc Pullen’s haunting score to craft a uniquely cinematic psychological journey.

title: Phobos Revisited
vibe: Flickering fluorescent corridors and toxic green pools of the Martian moon where familiar industrial layouts are sharpened with enhanced architectural depth.
praise: The meticulous attention to detail by Rex Claussen breathes new life into iconic layouts while preserving the classic atmosphere that earned it a Cacoward.

title: Phocas Island 2
vibe: A lonely, mist-shrouded archipelago where crumbling ruins and dense foliage hide secrets beneath the spray of a restless, gray ocean.
praise: The atmospheric world-building and intricate puzzle design of Chris Hopkins transform the engine into a true 90s-style adventure experience.

title: Piña Colada
vibe: Saturated, tropical vistas and surreal, color-shifted landscapes blend into a punchy, miniature odyssey through neon-soaked archipelagos and crystalline voids.
praise: Alex Decker and a talented community ensemble deliver a masterclass in micro-mapping, proving that strict monster limits can yield immense creativity.

title: Pirate Doom II
vibe: Sun-drenched Caribbean archipelagos and grog-filled shanty towns give way to bioluminescent undersea havens and the spectral, voodoo-haunted fortresses of a zombie pirate lord.
praise: The whimsical pirate atmosphere crafted by Darch transforms familiar demon-slaying into a vibrant, Monkey Island-inspired adventure filled with clever custom weaponry.

title: Pirate Doom
vibe: Sun-bleached tropical islands, haunted galleons, and grog-filled taverns collide in a whimsical Caribbean odyssey inspired by the golden age of point-and-click adventures.
praise: The imaginative world-building and clever asset replacements by Arch transform the engine into a vibrant, swashbuckling tribute to classic LucasArts adventures.

title: Plasmaplant
vibe: A high-contrast industrial facility bathed in monochromatic blue light, where sharp shadows hide unseen threats amidst intricate, sketch-inspired architecture.
praise: The striking blue aesthetic and intricate geometry mark a triumphant return for Sverre André Kvernmo, blending his classic Cabal-era design with modern ZDoom detail.

title: Plutonia 2
vibe: Moss-slicked Amazonian ruins and rusted UAAF research facilities collide within a humid, vine-choked wilderness that eventually dissolves into a jagged, blood-stained abyss.
praise: The punishing level design by Gusta and Rabotik perfectly captures the Casali spirit, propelled by a driving, original soundtrack from Jimmy.

title: Plutonia Revisited
vibe: Moss-covered Aztec temples and vine-choked brick fortresses sink into humid jungles, eventually fracturing into a recycled cyber-reality of jagged stone and toxic emerald pools.
praise: Joshy’s management unites veteran mappers like Matt Tropiano and Xaser to create a cohesive tribute punctuated by PRIMEVAL’s aggressive, jungle-themed score.

title: Preacher
vibe: Grim religious iconography haunts a pilgrimage through sun-scorched deserts, monochromatic noir cityscapes, and gothic cathedrals heavy with the weight of medieval martyrdom.
praise: The haunting country-gothic melodies of Those Poor Bastards perfectly complement the grim religious themes and striking visual identity crafted by Darch.

title: Putrefier
vibe: A decaying industrial facility rotting under a sickly green haze, where rusted machinery and organic filth merge into a claustrophobic nightmare of urban rot.
praise: The meticulous GZDoom detailing and haunting Zombi 2 cover by Edward Cripps transform a single map into an unparalleled masterpiece of atmospheric dread.

title: Reelism
vibe: A chaotic collision of digital voids, sugary landscapes, and gritty transit hubs shifting constantly under the neon glow of a cosmic slot machine.
praise: The chaotic slot machine mechanic introduced by Kinsie and collaborators transforms every match into an unpredictable, high-energy arcade spectacle.

title: REKKR
vibe: Gritty Norse landscapes of shipwrecked coasts and frozen fjords give way to moss-covered swamps and ancient runic halls where the line between Viking myth and alien horror blurs.
praise: The immersive low-fantasy world-building by Revae is elevated by Tom Jensen’s atmospheric soundtrack and TerminusEst13’s sound design for a complete transformation.

title: Remnant
vibe: Ancient, moss-covered masonry and jagged spires emerge from a lush, waterlogged wilderness where nature slowly reclaims the skeletal remains of a forgotten civilization.
praise: The sprawling scale and intricate environmental storytelling Henry Koivula crafts through the OTEX texture set earned this map its well-deserved Cacoward.

title: Resurgence
vibe: Sun-scorched savannas and frozen industrial complexes dissolve into blood-drenched libraries and jagged obsidian hellscapes suspended over claret-colored tides.
praise: The relentless momentum of Josh Sealy’s level design is elevated by the atmospheric, original compositions of John Weekley and Stuart Rynn.

title: Return to Hadron
vibe: A sprawling, high-tech research facility modeled after the Large Hadron Collider where sterile laboratory corridors and massive particle reactors gradually succumb to a crimson, void-warped corruption.
praise: The meticulous level design of Matt Powell transforms the scientific architecture of CERN into a series of award-winning, high-octane combat gauntlets.

title: Reverie
vibe: Sun-bleached Egyptian ruins and industrial fortresses drift through a hazy, dreamlike atmosphere that pays homage to the architectural language of the mid-nineties.
praise: The classic layouts of Michael Jan Krizik are elevated by a melodic, atmospheric soundtrack from PRIMEVAL, Jimmy, and stewboy.

title: Rowdy Rudy II: POWERTRIP
vibe: A gritty mercenary landscape where secret mountain laboratories and humid jungles house mutated super-soldiers and neon-eyed extraterrestrial invaders.
praise: The high-octane weapon replacements and DeHackEd monsters curated by Doomkid and his team transform this vanilla-compatible sequel into a definitive mercenary power trip.

title: RTC-3057
vibe: A sterile, high-tech labyrinth of flickering computer terminals and industrial decks suspended in the silent vacuum of deep space.
praise: Cinematic storytelling pioneered by Jacob Kruse and Team Future relies on complex ACS scripting and Julian Aubourg’s moody, atmospheric score.

title: Running Late 2
vibe: Gritty urban sprawl transitions from rain-slicked city streets and construction sites to the sterile, fluorescent-lit corridors of a corporate office complex.
praise: The punchy custom enemies and meticulously balanced pistol-start maps from A2Rob deliver a polished, high-energy experience that rightfully earned a Cacoward.

title: Saturnine Chapel
vibe: A somber, gothic chapel stands isolated amidst a sea of toxic green sludge and skeletal trees, eventually dissolving into a surreal, silent void of descending bookshelves.
praise: The oppressive atmosphere crafted by Darryl Steffen finds its perfect rhythmic pulse in the haunting, Egyptian-themed melodies composed by Ribbiks.

title: Scythe 2
vibe: Sun-bleached Egyptian tombs and overgrown jungle ruins give way to oppressive, obsidian-carved Gothic citadels and industrial complexes suspended over toxic wastes.
praise: The transition from bite-sized action to sprawling, meticulously detailed environments showcases Erik Alm’s evolution into one of the most influential level designers.

title: Sepia
vibe: A monochromatic landscape of muddy trenches and crumbling forts that gradually dissolves into a surrealist dreamscape of floating geometric cubes and glitching, redacted architecture.
praise: The striking monochromatic aesthetic and abstract geometry envisioned by Petyan, alongside contributions from Master Medi and Meowgi, redefine traditional megawad structure.

title: Shadows of Chronos
vibe: A crumbling, ancient capital where overgrown gardens and gothic sanctuaries are suspended in a temporal haze of autumnal forests and forgotten stone outposts.
praise: The atmospheric hub design by Samuel Villarreal perfectly captures the original game's spirit, enhanced by Kevin Schilder’s hauntingly familiar compositions.

title: Shadows of the Nightmare Realm
vibe: Non-Euclidean geometry twists through a dreamlike abyss of cosmic horror, where jagged textures and dynamic lighting illuminate a fractured, nightmarish subconscious.
praise: The haunting original score and abstract, non-Euclidean environments crafted by Remilia Scarlet create a uniquely oppressive atmosphere that redefines Doom horror.

title: Sheer Poison
vibe: A sprawling, toxic industrial complex where emerald sludge seeps through jagged metal corridors and occult sigils pulse against rusted machinery.
praise: The massive scale and intricate secret-hunting showcase Zan-zan-zawa-veia’s ability to push vanilla limits alongside a catchy, self-composed soundtrack.

title: Shotgun Symphony
vibe: A singular, interconnected Phobos installation where sterile tech-bases and industrial pumping stations merge into a cohesive labyrinth of steel, slime, and sprawling subterranean infrastructure.
praise: The seamless environmental transitions designed by Steve Duff transform this classic Phobos tribute into a singular, unbroken journey through a massive facility.

title: SIGIL
vibe: A stygian abyss of jagged obsidian and oppressive satanic iconography where flickering lava illuminates the hidden sigils of a corrupted, eldritch hellscape.
praise: John Romero’s return to hellish level design shines through punishing traps and satanic vistas accompanied by Buckethead’s legendary, shredding soundtrack.

title: Simplicity
vibe: A progression from sterile industrial power plants and hazard labs into a shadowy underworld where dark-skinned demons haunt blood-soaked fortresses and forgotten mine shafts.
praise: The tight, fast-paced level design by Melissa McGee revitalizes classic gameplay through creative ZDoom features and unique custom monster variants.

title: Simulacrum
vibe: Vibrant purples and oranges saturate a shifting, surrealist landscape of impossible architecture that oscillates between organic decay and celestial clockwork.
praise: The award-winning synergy between Muumi and Alex Decker delivers a polished, high-octane experience defined by its bold color theory and inventive MBF21-powered setpieces.

title: Sine Die
vibe: Sterile industrial corridors transition into the imposing glass-and-concrete sprawl of a metropolitan government headquarters looming over a desolate urban landscape.
praise: The intricate architectural realism and atmospheric urban scale achieved by Didy demonstrate why these two maps secured a 2007 Cacoward.

title: Skulldash
vibe: A central hub anchors a sprawling network of portals leading to frozen mountain peaks, submerged yellow submarines, ancient Egyptian tombs, and high-tech refineries.
praise: The frantic arcade-style scoring and time-trial mechanics introduced by Joshua O'Sullivan transform classic exploration into a high-speed, token-collecting dash.

title: Sleepwalking
vibe: Surreal domestic interiors fracture into a pastel-hued fever dream of floating whales, jagged geometric voids, and unsettlingly vibrant, saturated architecture.
praise: The haunting soundtrack and striking visual identity crafted by Ravendesk transform these intense combat puzzles into a cohesive, award-winning sensory experience.

title: Songs of the Damned
vibe: Vast marble courtyards and deep, subterranean pools connect through a series of monolithic structures that feel both ancient and industrial.
praise: The sprawling architecture and moody atmosphere of Trevor Primmett’s award-winning map create a sense of scale rarely seen in 2006.

title: Speed of Doom
vibe: A seamless journey through moss-slicked coastal grottos and subterranean machinery that eventually fractures into a nightmare of overgrown ruins and obsidian hellscapes.
praise: The punishing, high-octane level design of Josh Sealy and Darkwave0000 creates a relentless flow that evolves the brutal legacy of Plutonia.

title: Squenched Avacausage
vibe: Saturated neon greens and blues wash over a corporate nightmare of industrial food-processing plants, where pulsating organic veins merge with sterile, labyrinthine corridors.
praise: The dense environmental storytelling and inventive Boom-powered gimmicks crafted by nova++ transform a corporate food-processing nightmare into a surreal, award-winning adventure.

title: Stardate 20X6
vibe: An amethyst-tinted alien landscape where jagged sci-fi architecture and crystalline formations are bathed in a pervasive, haunting glow of deep purple and violet.
praise: The striking purple palette swap and intricate, punishing map design showcase the early mastery of Zachary Stephens over the slaughter genre.

title: Stardate 20X7
vibe: Ornate amethyst ballrooms and celestial sphinxes drift through a monochromatic void saturated in deep velvet violets and starlit purples.
praise: The intricate, purple-hued architecture and meticulous difficulty balancing showcase Zachary Stephens’ ability to craft punishing yet rewarding combat puzzles.

title: Strife: Absolute Order
vibe: The rain-slicked town of Sweetwater serves as a gateway to industrial waterworks and surreal, light-starved voids where a crumbling religious dictatorship still clings to power.
praise: The cohesive, interconnected world designed by Adam Woodmansey is perfectly complemented by a somber soundtrack featuring his own work and Sarah Mancuso.

title: Stronghold: On the Edge of Chaos
vibe: A sprawling network of fortified UAC outposts spanning asteroid belts, volcanic craters, and deep-space research stations connected by a central tactical command center.
praise: Tormentor667 and his team, including skillsaw and Vader, deliver a high-tech defense epic defined by an interactive shop and massive arsenal.

title: Struggle - Antaresian Legacy
vibe: A high-tech military campaign that dissolves into a cerulean-tinted dimension of serpent-guarded temples, magical tridents, and crystalline monuments under the light of Alpha Scorpii.
praise: The radical weapon overhauls and aggressive monster behaviors crafted by Seongbae Park transform the traditional Doom rhythm into a frantic, high-velocity experience.

title: Sunder
vibe: Monolithic, hyper-detailed structures of obsidian and bone loom over vast, impossible voids where ancient gardens and industrial furnaces collide in a cold, geometric nightmare.
praise: The architectural grandeur and innovative combat puzzles established by Insane_Gazebo redefined the slaughter genre, influencing a decade of map design.

title: Sunlust
vibe: Sun-scorched ruins and crystalline spires dissolve into abstract, geometric voids of deep purple and burning orange.
praise: Meticulous architectural precision from Zach Stephens and Daniel Jakobsson transforms high-contrast palettes into a visually stunning, award-winning masterclass of design.

title: Suspended in Dusk
vibe: Low-slung industrial complexes bathed in the amber glow of a dying sun, where rusted metal and heavy machinery cast long shadows across meticulously stacked crates.
praise: The meticulous texture alignment and architectural depth achieved by Esa Repo prove that vanilla limits are no barrier to creating a hauntingly immersive atmosphere.

title: Swift Death
vibe: Hyper-compressed dioramas of carnage where sterile lunar outposts and jagged volcanic crags are crushed into claustrophobic, lethal snapshots.
praise: The relentless, micro-scale combat puzzles designed by Franck Livolant prove that even the smallest rooms can harbor overwhelming, award-winning intensity.

title: Swim With The Whales
vibe: Shimmering azure sanctuaries and sleek, monochromatic architecture submerge the senses in a crystalline aquatic dreamscape of endless blue.
praise: Striking monochromatic aesthetics and meticulous combat puzzles showcase the signature high-pressure design style that Zachary Stephens is celebrated for.

title: Syringe
vibe: A surreal odyssey through fleshy pits and overgrown tropical ruins that eventually ascends into a bleeding lunar landscape and fractured reality.
praise: The distinct mapping styles of Walker Wright, Richard Frei, Michael Fraize, and Xaser converge in this punchy, high-concept adventure.

title: Tarnsman's Projectile Hell
vibe: Moonlit shrines and haunted libraries transition into celestial temples and ghostly passenger ships drifting through a kaleidoscope of Eastern folklore and cosmic voids.
praise: The meticulously rebalanced arsenal and projectile-focused encounters crafted by Tarnsman transform traditional combat into a rhythmic, high-speed dance of death.

title: Tech Gone Bad
vibe: A sprawling Phobos facility where high-tech computer bays and jagged rock islands are slowly being consumed by glowing red fissures and toxic green waste.
praise: This reimagined finale showcases the intricate sector detailing and verticality that John Romero pioneered, proving his classic design philosophy remains lethal.

title: Temple of Chaos 2 - Warped Reality
vibe: Sterile industrial corridors fracture and dissolve into a surreal landscape of red marble altars and glowing, molten rifts.
praise: The atmospheric custom score and menacing new threats like the Hectebus showcase Melissa McGee’s talent for creating dense, high-pressure ZDoom experiences.

title: The 10x10 Project
vibe: Minimalist geometric islands float within an infinite void, preceded by surreal, floating displays of the specific materials used to construct each reality.
praise: LunchLunch transforms strict texture limitations into a cohesive visual journey, complemented by Scotty’s interface work and Pixel Fiend’s graphic additions.

title: The Adventures of Square
vibe: A cel-shaded universe of sharp-edged geometry where neon-colored polygons inhabit surreal landscapes of paint factories, arctic labs, and lunar cheese craters.
praise: The imaginative world-building of BigBrik Games shines through James Paddock’s catchy soundtrack and Xaser’s inventive mechanics, creating a polished, pun-filled masterpiece.

title: The Classic Episode, Part 2
vibe: A sterile Martian industrial sprawl where high-tech laboratories and deep-space ports orbit a central, shifting hub of metallic corridors and glowing singularity chambers.
praise: The interconnected hub-and-spoke structure designed by Jan Van der Veken provides a cohesive sense of progression through polished, atmospheric Martian environments.

title: The Dying End
vibe: Ornate marble temples and crimson fortifications loom over a landscape of jagged rock, winding lava flows, and weeping flesh.
praise: The grand architectural scale and moody lighting Christopher Lutz crafts earned this map a Cacoward for its immersive, high-fidelity hellscape.

title: The Eye
vibe: A cyclopean arena of green stone and blood-slicked flesh tunnels spiraling upward toward a dizzying central staircase suspended over a dark, circular void.
praise: The circular architecture and escalating carnage showcase Cyriak Harris’s talent for transforming a single, massive arena into an award-winning gauntlet.

title: The Magenta Spire
vibe: An abstract, remote research station where reality fractures into a vivid spectrum of magenta hues and distorted, geometric corridors.
praise: The mechanical overhauls and surreal palette shifts introduced by Cole Bryden transform standard encounters into a vibrant, high-octane experimental odyssey.

title: The Outer Darkness
vibe: Intricate marble carvings and heavy timber beams form a decaying sanctuary adrift in a silent, pitch-black cosmic void.
praise: The meticulous sector detailing by Varun Abhirama Krishna elevates this gothic nightmare, while Damian Lee’s score heightens the sense of dread.

title: The Ultimate Torment and Torture
vibe: Fog-drenched gothic citadels and glowing industrial hellscapes collide in a world defined by intricate sector detail and shimmering particle effects.
praise: The cinematic scripting and custom arsenal integration showcase Daniel Gimmer’s pioneering ability to transform Doom into a high-fidelity, atmospheric adventure.

title: The Wayfarer
vibe: Verdant jade gardens and humid serpent pens give way to the cold, imposing architecture of obsidian citadels and mystical fountains hidden within a dark fantasy realm.
praise: The meticulous rebalancing of classic fantasy foes by Not Jabba transforms a familiar realm into a fresh, mechanically refined masterpiece.

title: The ZDoom Community Map Project "Take 2"
vibe: A sprawling, high-tech research facility transitioning from industrial lagoons and simulation chambers into a massive subterranean dig site that ruptures into a dark, gothic underworld.
praise: The monumental scale of this project unites Captain Toenail’s custom weaponry and Xaser’s scripting under Tormentor667’s direction for a feature-rich odyssey.

title: The ZDoom Community Map Project
vibe: A sprawling, experimental odyssey through high-tech facilities, flooded caverns, and shifting geometric chambers that culminates in a grand, ancient temple.
praise: Tormentor667’s ambitious vision unites Nanami’s custom bestiary and Grubber’s weaponry into a landmark showcase of early ZDoom scripting and technical ingenuity.

title: Three's a Crowd
vibe: A sprawling research complex where sterile industrial corridors warp into surreal architectural anomalies, featuring deceptive storefronts and unsettlingly repetitive geometry.
praise: The inventive level design by Scypek2 transforms a traditional research facility into a narrative-driven gauntlet filled with clever, experimental set-pieces.

title: Thunderpeak
vibe: A sprawling, high-tech industrial facility where humming reactors and massive cooling towers loom over a dense network of metallic catwalks and hidden ventilation shafts.
praise: The intricate industrial detailing by Björn Ostmann and Simon Judd’s atmospheric score elevate this powerplant into a legendary, award-winning adventure.

title: Thy Flesh turned into a draft-excluder
vibe: Gothic marble bastions and rusted industrial docklands sit precariously over toxic sludge, all under the oppressive gaze of a bruised orange sky.
praise: The brutal spirit of the original fourth episode is captured through Matt Powell’s knack for tight, punishing layouts and classic atmosphere.

title: TNT 2: Devilution
vibe: A sprawling network of high-tech research facilities and industrial outposts carved into desolate lunar rock, where sterile laboratories bleed into subterranean caverns and rusted maritime harbors.
praise: Intricate layouts by Alfonzo and valkiriforce breathe new life into the TNT legacy, perfectly complemented by Bucket’s driving, industrial-tinged soundtrack.

title: Total Control
vibe: A dense, hyper-detailed labyrinth of industrial machinery and flickering terminals where every corridor is packed with intricate metallic paneling and humming electrical conduits.
praise: The meticulous sector work and atmospheric lighting by Ronald Lubbelinkhof earned this map a Cacoward for its impressive technical polish.

title: Tremor
vibe: Sprawling industrial courtyards and hazardous chemical channels intersect within a massive, intricately detailed tech-base complex of hexagonal metal and flickering machinery.
praise: The ambitious scale and intricate detailing of Ross Mathieson’s architecture earned a Cacoward, perfectly complemented by DiluteCo’s atmospheric custom soundtrack.

title: Tribute - this is not the best wad in the world
vibe: A desolate, post-WWIII Earth where silent towns and radio-static transmissions hide a surreal convergence of modern cults and ancient Hoplite ghosts.
praise: The rare focus on single-player Skulltag features by Zalewa delivers a polished, boss-heavy experience that rightfully earned a 2009 Cacoward.

title: UAC Invasion: The Supply Depot
vibe: A sprawling industrial labyrinth of rusted metal and overgrown vines where massive cargo bays and flooded maintenance tunnels intersect beneath a lonely helipad.
praise: The meticulous eleven-year development by DooMknight shines through in the massive scale and dense environmental detail of this award-winning industrial epic.

title: UAC Ultra
vibe: Rusted industrial complexes and subterranean excavations defined by heavy metal plating, grimy machinery, and a pervasive, soot-stained atmosphere of decay.
praise: The cohesive industrial aesthetic forged by Jon Vail’s custom textures allows Jamie Bainbridge’s tight level design to shine through every gritty encounter.

title: Ultimate Doom In Name Only
vibe: A literalist architectural odyssey where abstract Phobos outposts and hellish voids are reconstructed into sprawling, functional industrial complexes and grand thematic monuments.
praise: The ambitious literalist concept initiated by Tristan Clark reaches its peak through the steady leadership and creative contributions of cannonball and dobu gabu maru.

title: Unhallowed
vibe: Monolithic industrial masonry and ornate gothic architecture collide within a sprawling, open-air cathedral of weathered stone and rusted metal.
praise: The grand architectural scale and meticulous OTEX detailing from Cyano Blugron create a cohesive, award-winning arena of overwhelming visual density.

title: Unholy Realms
vibe: Grime-streaked industrial basins and rusted storage yards give way to a descent through gothic brickwork and the crimson-stained architecture of the seven deadly sins.
praise: Compact, punchy layouts by Brian Knox find a perfect rhythm alongside PRIMEVAL's driving score and high-octane guest maps from skillsaw and Joshy.

title: Unloved
vibe: A decaying, domestic nightmare where suburban architecture dissolves into blood-slicked basements and surreal, shadow-drenched halls of childhood trauma.
praise: The oppressive atmosphere and terrifying custom monsters crafted by Paul Schneider transform a simple house into a haunting psychological masterpiece.

title: Urban Brawl: Dead of Winter
vibe: A gritty, cel-shaded metropolis of rain-slicked alleyways and flickering neon subways, framed by stark film noir shadows and hand-drawn comic book textures.
praise: The gritty comic book aesthetic crafted by Stephen Browning thrives through Mike Watson’s complex scripting and Ralph Vickers’ driving urban soundtrack.

title: Vae Victus 2
vibe: A somber, gothic-industrial descent through rain-slicked stone corridors and haunted mansions, where flickering shadows dance across cold masonry and rusted ironwork.
praise: The atmospheric level design and curated horror soundtrack by Derek Braun earned this sequel a well-deserved spot among the 2006 Cacoward winners.

title: Valhalla
vibe: Oppressive industrial ruins and rusted machinery sit shrouded in a heavy, dark atmosphere that echoes the moody, low-lit gloom of a forgotten tech-base.
praise: The staggering architectural detail and moody lighting crafted by Edward Cripps transform a single industrial map into a haunting, award-winning atmosphere.

title: Valiant
vibe: Clinical lunar outposts and jagged industrial zones are overtaken by a mutagenic rot, merging flesh with high-tech machinery under the glow of a dying moon.
praise: The extensive DeHackEd monster roster and refined map flow from Paul DeBruyne (skillsaw) create a relentlessly polished and modern megawad experience.

title: Vanguard
vibe: Moss-choked stone sepulchers and flooded shrines transition into industrial crate yards before descending into jagged, crimson-lit infernal chasms.
praise: Vibrant aesthetics and a punchy episodic structure showcase Paul DeBruyne’s talent for creating high-energy environments that feel classic yet fresh.

title: Vaporware Demo
vibe: A worn-down industrial cargo hub where desaturated blue tones and translucent steam drift across polished floors reflecting the complex, multi-story architecture.
praise: The technical wizardry of Sarah Mancuso transforms the Eternity Engine into a showcase of floor reflections and seamless room-over-room geometry.

title: Verdant Citadel
vibe: Moss-slicked stone ramparts and crumbling masonry are swallowed by aggressive overgrowth and winding waterways within a sprawling, emerald-hued fortress.
praise: The intricate architectural detail and lush environmental storytelling crafted by Dennis Meuwissen elevate this single-map adventure into a premier GZDoom showcase.

title: Void and Rainbow
vibe: Prismatic architecture and neon-lit pathways float within a silent, infinite vacuum, pulsing to the rhythm of a cyberpunk fever dream.
praise: The ethereal atmosphere and custom bestiary crafted by Serious＿MOod transform a single map into a haunting, award-winning psychedelic journey.

title: Whispers of Satan
vibe: Sterile high-tech outposts and urban brick corridors give way to vine-choked stone temples and a classic, obsidian-and-lava descent into the heart of the abyss.
praise: The atmospheric original soundtrack and diverse, high-detail environments crafted by Paul Corfiatis and Kristian Aro deliver a polished, award-winning megawad experience.

title: Winter's Fury
vibe: A frigid Siberian landscape where high-tech UAC vaults are buried beneath the jagged, snow-choked peaks of Mount Baphomet and patrolled by crystalline, ice-encrusted demons.
praise: The cinematic storytelling and intricate, portal-heavy architecture showcase Pyroscourge’s ability to transform a frozen wasteland into a cohesive, atmospheric journey.

title: worm\V/wood
vibe: A neon-drenched Halloween nightmare where glowing green eyes and vivid orange flames pierce through a surreal landscape of purple-tinted gothic architecture and flickering candlelight.
praise: The ingenious curse system and randomized item spawns highlight the mechanical brilliance Zachary Stephens and Grain of Salt bring to this eerie collaboration.
